data.prayer: Jesus, please find the broken hearted among the 2,930,100 souls in Puruliya and mend their wounds.
data.verse: He heals the brokenhearted and binds up their wounds.

data.location_label: Photo from the county of Puruliya, West Bengal, India
data.section_summary: What challenges do people here face?

data.prayer: Spirit, please defend the 32,231 believers in Puruliya against self-centered spirituality. Open their eyes to the fields ripe for harvest around them.
Father, look after and teach the way that is best for the 32,231 believers living in Puruliya, West Bengal, India.
data.verse: I will instruct you and teach you in the way you should go. I will counsel you with my loving eye on you.

data.prayer: Spirit, cause the 32,231 believers in Puruliya to obey with immediate, radical, costly obedience, like Abraham.
data.verse: Then God said, “Take your son, your only son, whom you love — Isaac — and go to the region of Moriah. Sacrifice him there as a burnt offering on a mountain I will show you.” Early the next morning Abraham got up and loaded his donkey. He took with him two of his servants and his son Isaac. When he had cut enough wood for the burnt offering, he set out for the place God had told him about.

data.prayer: Father, 0.0% are known to be believers. Please, Lord call more today.
Spirit, guide someone in the church in the county of Puruliya to a person ready to receive the message of the gospel, like Lydia, and who will then open her home to faith.
data.verse: One of those listening was a woman from the city of Thyatira named Lydia, a dealer in purple cloth. She was a worshiper of God. The Lord opened her heart to respond to Paul’s message.

data.prayer: Father, show your mercy on the 2,897,869 people in Puruliya who are far from you. Please add 586 new house churches this year.
Spirit, encourage the church in Puruliya, West Bengal, India to make the most of every opportunity.
data.verse: Be very careful, then, how you live—not as unwise but as wise, making the most of every opportunity, because the days are evil.
